question: My Vertuo Next is not pairing by Bluetooth to my device. What should I do ?
answer: If your device cannot connect to Bluetooth, please follow the steps below: - Log into your Nespresso account and delete the Vertuo Next device from the devices registered in the account;- Make a reset to factory settings;- Make sure that the device is turned on, because after two 2 minutes it stops automatically;- Go to the Bluetooth section of the device you are using and make sure that the device has been disconnected from the phone;- Make sure that the device that you use is connected to Wi-Fi, that has Bluetooth enabled and that location is turned on;the application version must also be the latest(if you do not have the most current version, please update it). Place your phone on your espresso machine and turn on the Nespresso app. Try to connect your device to the app. Please make sure that the device stays on throughout this process.

question: What is Reverso and how can I do it ?
answer: Reverso is the process of mixing milk with the creaminess of the extracted coffee, in order to spoil the taste buds. How can you go through this process? It will be necessary to add warm or cold milk into your cup for the first time, then extract the coffee on top to enjoy an extraordinary recipe.

question: Why can I not see my invoices on the Nespresso App?
answer:

For companies accounts, the invoice is available only on ANAF platform.

question: Where can I find my customer number?
answer:
Your Nespresso customer number is created when you place your first order via www.nespresso.com or when you have registered via the Customer Service Center on the phone or in our Boutique.

question: What can I do if the milk exceeds the circumference of the Aeroccino?
answer: First of all, you can press the button to stop the foaming. Inside the appliance there are two levels for the type of foaming. If this level is exceeded, milk leaks will occur near the lid.

question: What is the difference between an Original Lungo and a Vertuo Mug (230ml)?
answer: Both Original and Vertuo provide a high quality coffee that is larger than an Espresso (40ml). question: What does Vertuo Next stand for ?
answer: The Vertuo Next has been the pioneer on this new range, with Bluetooth that allows automatic updates. question: Why does Vertuo have a different range of coffee blends to the Original system?

This includes a rigorous bean selection, expert blending, roasting and grinding for an optimal interaction with the specific brewing parameters of the Vertuo machine. question: Can I use Volluto on my Vertuo Machine ?

question: What is Vertuo ?
answer: The Vertuo range represents an innovative system, which has introduced various ways of extracting coffee and a vast amount of aromatic notes through the Centrifusion™ method since 2014.

question: Can I make a cappuccino or latte with Vertuo coffees?

question: Why are some Vertuo capsules priced higher than Original capsules?
answer: The price of Nespresso Vertuo capsules reflects the innovative technology and the versatility that the machine offers in brewing multiple coffee preparations and varieties with the same, high quality in cup result. The sophisticated Vertuo capsules incorporate new technology, including a bar code on each capsule, which facilitates a product-intelligent extraction system, allowing the machine to recognize our masterful crafted assortments.

question: Is the Vertuo Range better than the Original Range ?
answer: The two systems are different and appeal to different types of coffee lovers.The Original range is designed for people seeking the classic espresso and espresso-based coffees, while Vertuo is for those who prefer a large cup of coffee. question: Can I recycle the Vertuo Pods as well ?

question: Do you plan to introduce more coffee blends into the Vertuo range?

question: Is there more aluminium in the Nespresso Vertuo capsules?
answer: Due to the fact that the Vertuo capsules are slightly bigger than the Original line, as they contain more coffee, it is required to use more aluminium. But, thanks to the recycling process we aim to re-use as much as we can the aluminium collected from the used capsules.

question: Will there be limited coffee editions for Vertuo Line? Will these be the same as in the Original Line?

question: Is Vertuo coffee the same as Americano?

question: What does Centrifusion™ technology stand for ?
answer: This innovation represents the most effective way of extracting a certain assortment due to the prolonged infusion time of the ground coffee with centrifugal force, in order to enjoy the very last drop of aromatic notes from each Vertuo capsule.

question: What is crema and why does the Vertuo range value it so much ?

question: Why is there a barcode on the capsules ?

question: Can I change the coffee extraction temperature in the Nespresso Vertuo machines?
answer: The coffee temperature cannot be modified, specific extraction parameters are established for each blend, to prepare the coffee in the most optimal way.

question: Why does it take so long to extract the coffee ?
answer: The Vertuo system is based on a 4-step extraction process of the capsules in order to obtain the best results. After heating the device - process that lasts less than for other devices (30sec) -the next step is reading the barcode and enter the pre-infusion stage, then finally extracting the coffee and drying the coffee grounds.

question: Will you discontinue the Original range ?
answer: No, the Original Range is the foundation of Nespresso, which has facilitated the spread of the Nespresso experience to millions of members. As we are constantly looking to innovate, the Vertuo range is the alternative for members who prefer to extract the assortments in higher quantities than the classic ones, Ristretto ,Espresso or Lungo.

question: How much coffee do the Vertuo Line Nespresso capsules contain?
answer:
The capsules in which the Nespresso assortments are packaged contain freshly ground and roasted coffee in varying amounts depending on the extraction method. Below you will find the grammage for one capsule of coffee.
- Ristretto and espresso - 7 grams
- Double espresso and Gran Lungo - 10 grams
- Mug - 12.5 grams
- Carafe - 17 grams

question: What is the caffeine content for the Vertuo capsules ?
answer: The caffeine content may vary for each assortment and is influenced by two major factors: the amount of Robusta used in a capsule (Robusta contains twice as much caffeine as Arabica),as well as the quantity of ground coffee used to prepare the cup. For instance, the caffeine level for Espresso and Gran Lungo sizes ranges from 70 to 150 mg, and for Mug and Alto it may vary from 170 to 200 mg.For Carafe, the caffeine content is between 220 and 250 mg, but this particular coffee size is recommended to be drank in 2 or 3 portions.

question: The machine is on, but no water comes out. The capsule is not punctured. What can I do?
answer: Your machine may have an air bubble. Air bubbles can block the flow of water through the spout. They usually occur if the machine is operated without water in the tank or has not been used for a long period. Eject any capsule, ensure there is water in the tank, and then follow the troubleshooting tips below. For Vertuo Line machines, follow the Cleaning instructions in your User Manual. Please be persistent; this might take a few tries. For further assistance, please call our Specialists via our toll-free number: 0800008300.

question: Why wasn't the Centrifusion™ technology used for the Original line as well ?
answer: Because this new technology is an innovation from 2014 and the process of extracting is different for Vertuo and Original Line. The Original line is well known for high-pressure 19 bar extraction system and is designed for coffee lovers which prefer the coffee extracted the classic way, espresso and lungo, whilst Centrifusion™ is designed for larger amounts of coffee extracted.

question: I tried to pair my Vertuo Next machine and I received the message “Machine unavailable. Detected machine was unable to pair." Is my machine used? What should I do?
answer: The message you received is due to quality checks during the manufacturing of the devices. We assure you that your device is unused. To solve this alert, we would ask you to open and close the head of the device, then leave the extraction unit in the unlocked position. Turn on the espresso machine and when the white light is stable quickly press 5 times per button in 3 seconds;the button will quickly blink 5 times orange and then return to stable white colour. Now you can connect your machine to your device.

question: My Vertuo Next does not connect to wi-fi ? What can I do ?
answer: Make sure that the device is connected to a stable power source. If the device was turned off, you need to turn it on and as far as the Nespresso application is concerned, you need to close it and reopen it.- Check for a strong Wi-Fi signal.- go to the Nespresso app and access the connectivity section, then the application will scan possible Wi-Fi networks. If no network is detected, select the refresh option at the bottom of the screen. If the device still does not detect the wi-fi network you want, close the Nespresso application and make sure that the device is still on and resume the first 3 steps. When the device finds the desired wi-fi network, you will need to enter the corresponding password to connect. In the connectivity section the status "Connected" should be displayed.

question: I enjoy using my favorite mug, however, it does not fit on the base of the Vertuo can I adjust the base to accommodate my mug?
answer: The Vertuo Pop machine is designed to be able to accommodate cup sizes up to 12.5 cm high. If you regularly use a bigger cup, we would recommend the Vertuo Next machine that can accommodate higher cup sizes.

question: What is the life expectancy of the Vertuo Pop machines?
answer: The Vertuo machine is designed for normal household consumption, meaning less than 20 cups per day.  You may enhance the lifetime of your machine by descaling and cleaning it regularly following the instructions in the user manual.

question: What is the connectivity for?
answer: Connecting/Pairing your machine with your phone will allow your machine to automatically download and install software updates when not in use. This will allow you to enjoy the best coffee experience with the best in cup results every time. The App will also help you communicate better with your Vertuo Pop machine by enabling you to trigger certain procedures using the App. You can also check the status of your Vertuo pop machine using the app.

question: Can I use classic Nespresso capsules in the Vertuo machines?
answer: No. The classic Nespresso capsules cannot be used in the Vertuo machine system. They interact with the systems in different ways. These are two separate lines that will appeal to different types of coffee lovers.

question: How many coffees can I make before the machine overheats? How does that compare with the Original Line machines?
answer: Vertuo Pop is designed mainly for household use but it is also compatible for use in small offices so it will not overheat.

question: Why is there no integrated milk solution?
answer: There is the possibility of buying the Aeroccino 3 or the Aeroccino 4 alongside the Vertuo machine in order to create the ultimate milk frothing experience.

question: Is the machine made of recycled materials?
answer: Yes, Vertuo Pop is made with more than 35% recycled plastics

question: Why is the coffee extraction so long?
answer: The Nespresso Vertuo technology requires a 5 phase extraction process to provide the perfect in-cup result.  The heat up time only takes less than a minute which makes the total preparation time faster than the average standards.  The infusion, particularly, takes additional time helping solubilize coffee compounds for optimal extraction.  'Anything gourmet takes time!'

question: Why the colours of the button are different ?
answer: The button lights up in different colours and can blink differently in order to better understand what error or which process the machine is conducting. For flashing white light- the machine is heating up and when the white light is stable the coffee machine is ready to be used. When the button is pulsating white, please ensure that the machine is closed properly, and when closing the upper part make sure the closed lock symbol is used. The pulsating orange and white light implies the fact that the descaling process must be done as soon as possible; until the process is finished, the machine can still extract any assortment. When the machine displays the orange light without any blinking, the descaling process must be done immediately and the machine will not extract any more coffee. If the light is blinking orange, please make sure that a capsule is introduced and make sure the extraction head is not blocked. When the machine displays the blue color, please verify the bluetooth connection.If the LED shows a red alert, there can be several reasons, and also the light cadence of the device can vary, i.e. if the LED flashes red every 0.5 seconds, please check the water level in the tank. If the LED flashes white once and then red/orange twice, it is possible that the device does not recognise the assortment you have introduced, thus we would ask you to clear the device and update the software version of the device. When the LED of the espresso machine flashes twice quickly and then pauses, your device has encountered an electronic error, so please disconnect and reconnect the device to the power supply after 10 seconds, and if the problem persists please return to the factory settings. question: There is no water coming out of the coffee outlet. What can I do?

For the Essenza and Le Cube machine, simply lift the coffee lever and push it away from you. While applying pressure, press either cup button until water appears in the capsule chamber.
CitiZ, Pixie, and Lattissima owners can fill the water tank, eject any capsule in the chamber, close the coffee lever and press either cup button. The auto-prime function will push the air from the circuit. When water begins to flow through the spout, the air bubble has been released. For owners of machines with steam functions, it is best to activate the steam/hot water function. The lower pressure this function operates with allows the air to be released with greater ease.
You are welcome to contact Nespresso Customer Service for further assistance on our free-phone number 0800 00 8300, from Monday to Friday, 08:00 - 20:00.

question: Aeroccino - How should I maintain my Aeroccino?
answer:
We advise you to let the device cool down between 2 preparations.

question: How do I get a milk foam as dense as possible with the Aeroccino?
